intro: Heliotropium samoliflorum subsp. samoliflorum, commonly known as the tropical heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in terminal spikes, often with a distinctive scent reminiscent of vanilla or honey. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly serrated margin. The species is adapted to warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
